action.content:
You are a language wizard who likes to guess words by using the given rules.

Welcome to Wordle! You have six attempts to guess the target word, a valid English word of five lowercase letters (a-z). Please use the tags "explanation:" and "guess:" to provide a concise explanation for each guess.

For instance, if your guess is "apple", your response should be
explanation: this is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.
guess: apple

After each guess, your answer will be validated, and you will receive feedback indicating which letters are correct (green), which letters are correct but in the wrong position (yellow), and which letters are incorrect (red). This feedback can be useful in determining which letters to include or exclude in your next guess.

For example, the feedback for "apple" might be:
guess_feedback: a<yellow> p<yellow> p<green> l<yellow> e<red>

The explanation should contain details about how the guess_feedback is used to arrive at a new guess.

Do not generate any other text.

Let's begin with your first guess.

explanation: I will start with a common five-letter word that includes a variety of vowels and consonants to gather initial feedback on the target word.  
guess: crane

attempts = 1
target_word = think
guess = crane
guess_feedback = c<red> r<red> a<red> n<green> e<red>

guess_feedback: c<red> r<red> a<red> n<green> e<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letter "n" is in the correct position (green). The letters "c", "r", "a", and "e" are not in the word (red). I will choose a new word that includes "n" in the fourth position and excludes the incorrect letters.  
guess: sonic

attempts = 2
target_word = think
guess = sonic
guess_feedback = s<red> o<red> n<yellow> i<yellow> c<red>

guess_feedback: s<red> o<red> n<yellow> i<yellow> c<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letter "n" is in the word but not in the fourth position (yellow), and "i" is also in the word but not in the fourth position (yellow). The letters "s", "o", and "c" are not in the word (red). I will choose a word that includes "n" and "i" but excludes the incorrect letters and places "n" and "i" in new positions.  
guess: blink

attempts = 3
target_word = think
guess = blink
guess_feedback = b<red> l<red> i<green> n<green> k<green>

guess_feedback: b<red> l<red> i<green> n<green> k<green>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letters "i", "n", and "k" are in the correct positions (green). The letters "b" and "l" are not in the word (red). I will choose a word that includes "i", "n", and "k" in their correct positions and excludes "b" and "l".  
guess: think

attempts = 4
target_word = think
guess = think
guess_feedback = t<green> h<green> i<green> n<green> k<green>

guess_explanation: I will start with a common five-letter word that includes a variety of vowels and consonants to gather initial feedback on the target word.

The letter "n" is in the correct position (green). The letters "c", "r", "a", and "e" are not in the word (red). I will choose a new word that includes "n" in the fourth position and excludes the incorrect letters.

The letter "n" is in the word but not in the fourth position (yellow), and "i" is also in the word but not in the fourth position (yellow). The letters "s", "o", and "c" are not in the word (red). I will choose a word that includes "n" and "i" but excludes the incorrect letters and places "n" and "i" in new positions.

The letters "i", "n", and "k" are in the correct positions (green). The letters "b" and "l" are not in the word (red). I will choose a word that includes "i", "n", and "k" in their correct positions and excludes "b" and "l".
